wikipedia_page.main:
William Milne (23 March 1852 – 16 March 1923) was a British sport shooter who competed at the 1908 Summer Olympics and the 1912 Summer Olympics.In the 1908 Summer Olympics he participated in the following events:

disappearing target small-bore rifle - fourth place
moving target small-bore rifle - seventh place
stationary target small-bore rifle - 14th placeFour years later in 1912 he won the silver medal in the 50 metre rifle, prone as well as with the British team in the team 25 metre small-bore rifle competition. In the individual 25 metre small-bore rifle event he finished 22nd.
He had an illustrious Army career, serving with the 92nd Gordon Highlanders in India, Afghanistan and South Africa. In 1902 he was selected to fill a vacancy in the King's Bodyguard of the Yeomen of the Guard. Apart from this appointment, he had retired from the Army and became Steward of the London Scottish Golf Club.His family comprised sons James, Douglas, and Gordon, and daughters Annie and Doris. He was survived by his wife Mary.
